adjectives.description: unhinged (comparative more unhinged, superlative most unhinged)

entries.meaning: (figuratively, usually humorous) Mentally ill or unstable.
examples: After the screening, a large crowd filled the street outside the theater, playing spot-the-sublebrity with some of the film's prime characters, including Nirvana photographer Alice Wheeler and Love's estranged (and notoriously unhinged) father.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of unhinge

adjectives.description: unhinged (comparative more unhinged, superlative most unhinged)

entries.meaning: (philately, of a stamp) Not having ever been mounted using a stamp hinge.
